main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Winter and Olijwa, Wisconsin on July 15, 1954. The object was described as round, silver, solid, and hanging/bobbing with back-and-forth movement. It was observed for 15-20 minutes, resembling a balloon and changing color as the moon rose in the east.
interesting points: The object was described as disc-type, with specific measurements of 42x22', 26-30' diameter, and 22-25' unavailable.
The sighting involved a civilian witness from Winter, Wisconsin, who timed the object and reported the initial sighting.
The report mentions the belief that the object was dropped out of or off of a jet type aircraft.
The observation lasted for 15-20 minutes, during which the object was moving back and forth from north to south.
The reliability of the witness is described as excellent.
sighted object: Round, silver, solid object hanging and bobbing with back-and-forth movement
